I think that's a great idea. I'll definitely consider including a section on the lessons I've learned from my grandmother's journey with Alzheimer's. It'll be a powerful way to reflect on the experience and how it's shaped me as a person. I'll make sure to approach the section with honesty and vulnerability, and use storytelling techniques to make it more engaging and relatable.

One thing I'm also thinking about is how to organize the memory book. I want to make sure it flows well and is easy to follow. Do you have any suggestions on how to organize the sections and create a clear structure for the book?
